CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Device based on PIDT - EHNT obtained a low PCE of 1.49% , with a J sc of 4.33 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.86 V and a FF of 40% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT |
| EHNT |
| V oc |
| FF |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT |
| EHNT |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "V oc" (short for "voltage of operation")
* "FF" (short for "fill factor")

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Device based on PIDT - EHNT obtained a low PCE of 1.49% , with a J sc of 4.33 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.86 V and a FF of 40% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE (Percentage of Carbon Excess) |
| J sc (Current density) |
| V oc (Open-circuit voltage) |
| FF (Fill factor) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE (Percentage of Carbon Excess) |
| FF (Fill factor) |

Note that "J sc" and "V oc" are not valid "Property Name" entities in this context, as they are not material properties.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Device based on PIDT - EHNT obtained a low PCE of 1.49% , with a J sc of 4.33 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.86 V and a FF of 40% .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (%) | 1.49% |
| Jsc (mA cm^-2) | 4.33 mA cm^-2 |
| Voc (V) | 0.86 V |
| FF (%) | 40% |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Property Value" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (%) | 1.49% |
| Voc (V) | 0.86 V |
| FF (%) | 40% |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to the value of a material property:

* "Jsc" (mA cm^-2) - This is the current density, not a property value.
* "PCE" (%) - This is the power conversion efficiency, which is a measure of the efficiency of the device, not a property value.
* "FF" (%) - This is the fill factor, which is a measure of the efficiency of the device, not a property value.
